title: Two-Bedroom Apartment in London’s Mayfair to Rent for £30,000 Per Month
text:
An apartment in London’s affluent Mayfair neighborhood that will be renting for £30,000 (US$36,882) per month is set to be shopped to an exclusive selection of potential tenants starting Monday.



The two-bedroom residence in the recently completed Clarges Mayfair building will be shown by invitation only, according to a press representative for Wetherell, the brokerage handling the listing.



More: English Soccer Star John Terry Buys £4.35 Million Country Manor

Spanning 1,593 square feet and full of contemporary and Art Deco influences, the home has an emerald, charcoal, brass and cream color palette that was inspired by the colors of adjacent Green Park and executed by Martin Kemp Design.



It has coffered ceilings, bespoke joinery, custom flooring and seven Juliet balconies, according to a news release.



The master bedroom suite has floor-to-ceiling windows, bespoke fitted wardrobes and a marble master bathroom.



From Penta: How Not to Lose Money When Flipping a House

The apartment “is arguably the finest residence ever released onto the Mayfair lettings market,” Peter Wetherell, chief executive of Wetherell, said in the release.



“Why rent a large suite at The Lanesborough or The Berkeley [hotels] when you can let this apartment at Clarges Mayfair and have the luxury of your own private home and all the benefits of a luxury hotel,” he added.



The nine-story Portland stone building is home to 34 residences, along with a host of amenities, including a swimming pool, a spa with four private treatment rooms, a cinema room with bespoke couches, a 24-hour concierge and underground parking with a car lift.
